marketNews.title: Kemendag Proposes Up to 200% Import Duty for Chinese Ceramics
marketNews.content:
The Indonesian Ministry of Trade’s Anti‑Dumping Committee (KADI) on 2 July 2024 recommended an anti‑dumping import duty (BMAD) ranging from 100.12% to 199.88% for ceramic imports from China. The recommendation was issued after KADI concluded a causal link between the loss of the domestic ceramic industry and dumping imports from China. Currently, imported ceramics are subject to a Safeguard Import Duty (BMTP) of 13% under Minister of Finance Regulation No. 156/PMK.010/2021, effective until November 2024. Despite this, domestically produced ceramics remain uncompetitive with Chinese imports. According to KADI, Chinese ceramic imports accounted for 41% of national consumption in the July 2021–June 2022 period, while 49% came from domestic producers and 10% from other countries. 

Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Association (Asaki), Edy Suyanto, told Investor Daily that KADI’s findings reflect government fairness and support for the sustainability of the national ceramic industry. He explained that the domestic ceramic sector has been battered by imports, with factory utilization falling from 75% in 2022 to 63% in the first half of 2024. 

The exact date when the BMAD regulation will be implemented remains unknown. On Friday 5 July, Trade Minister Zulkifli Hasan said the government will continue investigating a broader range of goods from various countries that may be subject to BMAD. In addition to ceramics, the ministry will monitor imports of textiles, apparel, footwear, cosmetics, and electronics. 

Edy added that importers are likely to use the gap between the KADI report and the BMAD implementation to import large volumes to avoid the duty. 

Key Takeaway: We assess that the BMAD policy will benefit domestic ceramic producers such as Arwana Citramulia (ARNA) and Cahayaputra Asa Keramik (CAKK) because Chinese ceramic prices will rise with the duty, making local ceramics more competitive, potentially boosting plant utilization and profitability. However, if importers stockpile Chinese ceramics during the grace period, a lagging effect could delay the expected sales increase for the domestic industry.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Foreign Exchange Reserves Rise to $140.2 Billion
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia’s foreign exchange reserves rose to US$140.2 billion at the end of June 2024, up from US$139 billion in May 2024. The increase was driven by tax and service receipts and foreign‑loan drawdowns by the government, supporting the rupiah’s exchange‑rate stability. The reserve level is equivalent to financing 6.3 months of imports or 6.1 months of imports plus external‑government debt service.

marketNews.title: Indef: Government Has Only Two Options to Boost Fiscal Capacity
marketNews.content: Esther Sri Astuti, Executive Director of the Institute for Development of Economics and Finance (Indef), said the Prabowo‑Gibran administration has only two options to expand fiscal capacity: increase state revenue or prioritize priority spending. She noted that the government will face debt maturities of IDR 3,749 trillion between 2025‑2029 as the debt‑to‑GDP ratio rises from 30.6% in 2019 to 39.3% in 2023.

marketNews.title: Budget Committee Proposes IDR 598.9 Trillion Additional 2025 Budget
marketNews.content: Chairman of the House Budget Committee, Said Abdullah, said eleven commissions in the DPR have proposed an additional IDR 598.9 trillion in the 2025 state budget. The proposal follows requests from ministries and agencies for higher 2025 allocations, but Said asked Finance Minister Sri Mulyani to keep the additional spending from widening the 2025 budget deficit, which is projected at 2.29%–2.82% of GDP.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Says First 100% Indonesian‑Owned Smelter to Operate by End‑2024
marketNews.content: Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Arifin Tasrif announced that Indonesia’s first 100% Indonesian‑owned smelter, the RKEF smelter owned by PT Ceria Nugraha Indotama (CNI), will begin commissioning by the end of 2024. The plant, with a capacity of 252,700 tonnes per year, is financed by domestic banks, notably Bank Mandiri. CNI previously disclosed plans for an IPO on the Indonesia Stock Exchange in the first half of 2025.

marketNews.title: Tourism Minister Projects 14 Million Foreign Visitors in 2024
marketNews.content: Tourism and Creative Economy Minister Sandiaga Uno said the government is optimistic that total foreign visitor arrivals could reach 14 million in 2024, driven by collaboration with tourism operators. The 14‑million target is the initial government goal for 2024; however, in February 2024 Sandiaga raised the target to 17 million. In the first five months of 2024, BPS recorded a 23.78% year‑on‑year increase to 5.24 million visitors, still only 30.8% of the 17‑million target.

marketNews.title: SRAJ Plans Private Placement of Up to 1.2 Billion New Shares
marketNews.content: Sejahtera Anugrahjaya (SRAJ) plans a private placement of up to 1.2 billion new shares, which would dilute existing shareholders by up to 9.09%. The issue price and investors have not been disclosed. Proceeds will be used to repay debt to controlling shareholder PT Surya Cipta Inti Cemerlang and to develop Mayapada hospitals in Jakarta, Batam, and Surabaya. The plan will be discussed at an independent general meeting on 12 August 2024.

marketNews.title: Presidential Staff Coordinator Says 2024 Local Elections Remain on Schedule
marketNews.content: Koordinator Staf Khusus Presiden Ari Dwipayana said the simultaneous 2024 regional elections will proceed as scheduled and are not affected by the dismissal of KPU Chairman Hasyim Asy'ari. The KPU has appointed Mochammad Afifuddin as acting chairman effective 4 July 2024, after the Honorary Council of Election Organizers dismissed Hasyim for sexual‑harassment allegations.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Seeks Up to US$1.5 Billion Loan for Mine Expansion
tickerNews.content: Amman Mineral International is seeking a loan of up to US$1.5 billion to expand the Batu Hijau mine. Bloomberg reported that the company has secured commitments from several banks, including Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), for the loan. An AMMN spokesperson declined to comment.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Amends Coal Mining Services Term‑Sheet, Extends Contract Value to US$1.08 Billion
tickerNews.content: Petrosea signed an amendment and restated term‑sheet for a coal mining services contract with its subsidiary Singaraja Putra (SINI) and PT Pasir Bara Prima. The updated agreement extends the contract life to the mine’s life with an estimated contract value of US$1.08 billion, and raises the overburden production estimate to 415.4 million bcm and coal production to 52 million tonnes. The previous term‑sheet, signed on 27 March 2024, covered US$511.45 million of services through 2032 with 240 million bcm overburden and 26.4 million tonnes of coal.

tickerNews.title: VKTR Shareholder Sells 3.09 Billion Shares, Reducing Stake to 14.98%
tickerNews.content: PT Bakrie Metal Industries, the shareholder of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas, sold 3.09 billion VKTR shares at an undisclosed price on 24 June 2024. After the transaction, Bakrie’s ownership fell from 22.05% to 14.98%.

tickerNews.title: PT PP Posts IDR 9.5 Trillion H1 2024 Contract Value
tickerNews.content: PT PP recorded a new contract value of IDR 9.5 trillion (‑18.2% YoY) in the first half of 2024, representing 29.7% of the 2024 target of IDR 32 trillion. The revenue was driven by road and bridge projects (54.41% of the total), with building projects contributing 39.57% and other projects the remainder.

tickerNews.title: BEI Says GOTO Will Not Enter Special Monitoring Board
tickerNews.content: BEI Director Jeffrey Hendrik said GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) will not be placed on the special monitoring board with a full‑call‑auction mechanism despite the stock’s three‑month flat price at IDR 50 per share. He explained that GOTO remains liquid, with an average daily turnover above IDR 5 million.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Shareholder Increases Stake to 40.20% After Buying 7.03 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: PT Paraga Artamida, the controlling shareholder of Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE), bought approximately 7.03 million BSDE shares at an average price of IDR 953 per share between 27 June and 2 July 2024, totaling about IDR 6.7 billion. After the purchase, its ownership rose from 40.16% to 40.20%.

tickerNews.title: NFCX Subsidiary ESB Secures Investment for EV Fleet and Battery‑Swap Expansion
tickerNews.content: NFC Indonesia announced that its subsidiary PT Energi Selalu Baru (ESB) received investment from LX Ventures and SAIC Capital in a pre‑Series A round. The total amount was not disclosed. ESB plans to use the funding to develop a Volta electric‑vehicle fleet and expand battery‑swap infrastructure.
